qas.question: On what date do Jehovah Witnesses believe Jesus Christ began his rule as a king in God's kingdom?
What happened to Satan when Jesus started his rule?
How do Jehovah Witnesses believe that Jesus rules?
How is the Greek word parousia translated when referring to Christ?

answers.text: when he comes to bring a final judgment

qas.question: In what month of 1914 was Satan tossed out of heaven?
What do most Greek scholars think "presence" translates to in Greek?
How do Jehovah's Witnesses think Satan appears to people on Earth since 1914?
When do Jehovah's Witnesses now think Armageddon is going to strike?

context: Jehovah's Witnesses believe that Jesus Christ began to rule in heaven as king of God's kingdom in <a0_0><b5_0>October<b5_0/> 1914<a0_0/>, and that Satan was subsequently <a1_0>ousted from heaven<a1_0/> to the earth, resulting in "woe" to humanity. They believe that Jesus rules <a2_0><b7_0>invisibly<b7_0/><a2_0/>, from heaven, perceived only as a series of "signs". They base this belief on a rendering of the Greek word <b6_0>parousia<b6_0/>—usually translated as <a3_0>"coming"<a3_0/> when referring to Christ—as "presence". They believe Jesus' presence includes an <b8_0>unknown<b8_0/> period beginning with his inauguration as king in heaven in 1914, and ending <a4_0>when he comes to bring a final judgment<a4_0/> against humans on earth. They thus depart from the mainstream Christian belief that the "second coming" of Matthew 24 refers to a single moment of arrival on earth to judge humans.
